The seven-member cabinet also agreed to freeze any assets belonging to Laurent Gbagbo of Ivory Coast, who is clinging to power despite having lost a presidential election to Alassane Ouattara in November. The government decided at its meeting today[ Wednesday] to freeze any funds in Switzerland of the ex-Tunisian president and his entourage with immediate effect, Swiss President and Foreign Minister Micheline Calmy-Rey said at a news conference in Bern.
